goal.tools.mc.program

Interface Program

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Automaton
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GOALProg, GOALPrologProg

    public interface Program
extends Automaton
    Represents the program component of a model checker, which basically is a representation of an automaton (which is why this interface extends Automaton).
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getMemoryConsumption()
      Gets the current memory consumption of computation of the program that is not Java-related, i.e.
      java.lang.String getPerformedAction(State state, State successorState)
      Gets the action (as a string of text) that need be performed to get from the specified state to its successor.
      void slice()
      Slices the program.

      • Methods inherited from interface goal.tools.mc.core.Automaton

        generate, getInitial, getSize, getSuccessors

    • Method Detail

      • getPerformedAction

        java.lang.String getPerformedAction(State state,
                                  State successorState)
        Gets the action (as a string of text) that need be performed to get from the specified state to its successor.
        Parameters:
        state - - The state in which the action to be determined need be performed.
        successorState - - The state that results from performing the action to be determined.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the action if the successor can be reached; null otherwise.

      • slice

        void slice()
        Slices the program. Assumes that all necessary information to compute the slice is already present (for instance as class fields), hence no parameters are passed.

      • getMemoryConsumption

        long getMemoryConsumption()
        Gets the current memory consumption of computation of the program that is not Java-related, i.e. does not involve the Java heap. For instance, if Prolog is in any way during successor generation, this method should return Prolog's memory demands.
        Returns:
        The memory consumption.
